headline: Sweet and Spicy Venison Jerky
description: This tasty venison jerky is sweet, smoky, and spicy thanks to the addition of brown sugar, teriyaki sauce, liquid smoke, spices, and hot pepper sauce.
name: Sweet and Spicy Venison Jerky
recipeIngredient: 1 pound venison, cut into 1/4 thick strips

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk teriyaki sauce, Worcestershire sauce, sugar, soy sauce, liquid smoke, pepper, onion powder, garlic salt, lemon juice, paprika, and hot pepper sauce together in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Add venison strips and toss to evenly coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 24 hours, stirring it a few times as it marinates to ensure even absorption of marinade.
Remove venison strips from marinade and squeeze off excess. Discard remaining marinade. Arrange venison on the racks of a food dehydrator in a single layer.
Dry venison on High until dry but still pliable, about 4 hours. Jerky should bend without breaking. Store jerky in an airtight container or in a resealable plastic bag.

review.reviewBody: Second time with this recipe.. I did not like twang with teriyaki sauce, so I modified for a better result. Same recipe, but instead of teriyaki sauce, I used 1/2cup of hickory BBQ sauce and also added 4 tablespoons of honey and also added 1 tablespoon of cayenne instead of hot pepper sauce and also added 2 tablespoons of seasoning salt. Once modified, it's some of the best jerky I have ever had. I dried to perfection and will use new recipe forever! Try it! You won't regret the modifications!
Delicious! If you want it spicy cut the sugar in half double the paprika and triple the tobasco sauce. This recipe, as is, is very mild.
I doubled the recipe and Added 1 teaspoon cayenne. It was good for three pounds of venison and was awesome, one of the best. Thanks!

Couple of things to note here. I had two pounds of meat so I doubled the recipe but there was way more marinade than needed. Make the recipe as is but add 2 pounds of meat instead of 1. That way you at least fill up a few of the trays in the dehydrator to make it worth you while. The other thing to note that if cut to the thickness as written, you will need to plan on 4-5 hours of drying time. My teeny tiny scraps needed 3 1/2 hours and the rest needed 4-5 hours. All venison and dehydrators are not created so just keep an eye out on it. Flavor was great!
Outstanding. Not too sweet, not too spicy. This is Baby Bear's. Baby Bear's was JUST RIGHT. (From the story of The Three Bears.)
Made it, minus the brown sugar.

I made this but did a lot of tweaking to the recipe and it turned out perfect. As others mentioned I cut the liquid smoke in half, doubled the pepper and added red hot pepper flakes. I did not have teriyaki sauce so I substituted that with soy sauce and a teaspoon of ginger powder. I also was unsure what hot pepper sauce was so I used 2 tablespoons of Sriracha sauce. It is so tasty! Already marinating a second batch. I did not have a dehydrator but I used the dehydrator function on my Instant Pot Omni Plus and it didn’t get too dry at all!
A bit too sweet for our family.
I added some honey to the recipe. And the end product is sweet and good. Spice not there much so next time i make it i will double the spice part or add some crushed red pepper flakes.

Wow. This is a great recipe! A nice way to clear out some of the venison roasts have have been crowding the freezer. Like many of the other reviewers, I added a lot more hot sauce than the recipe called for, and also added a little more brown sugar. Delicious!
This turned out really good I will definitely be making more

I used this recipe and shared the finished product with various people. So far everyone has loved it. The highest compliment came from a meat processor who makes jerky, he asked if I sold it and why I didn’t. He claimed it was the best he has ever had including his. 

I highly recommend this recipe to anyone who has a smoker for their jerky.
Very good.

First time making venison jerky. This was awesome. Kids can't stop eating. Only thing I added was a cracked pepper rub sprinkled over before throwing into smoker. 
I was expecting 4 hours but ours was done at 2 hours.
Best jerky I've ever made. Everyone loves it. Can't wait to get another deer!

I have made this recipe at least 10 times, and it's amazing. Each time I make jerky I do this one and try two more, and this one is always the winner. I use thick teriyaki sauce which makes it a little more sticky - delicious.
Made it but added more venison. It turned out awesome! This is a keeper!

Not sweet enough and DEFINITELY not hot enough, and I doubled the hot sauce called for! Next time I'll double the brown sugar, and quadruple the hot sauce, with possible a hotter sauce (I used good ol' Tabasco). Lots more deer in the freezer from this season to try again!
Youll wish you shot another deer. Everybody loves this stuff. If u leave it out it will disappear. I will probably never try a different recipe
Best jerky marinade I've ever used. II soaked the venison in saltwater overnight before marinating it. To cook/dry it I put in the grill for four hours with a smoker tray/hickory chips.
Excellent recipe a must try
I tripled the recipe as I was making 5 pounds of deer meat into jerky. The jerky turned out delicious! I can't stop eating it! I will definitely use this marinade recipe again!

Delicious jerky! We like everything extra spicy, so I added 3 tbsp of sriracha sauce and a good sprinkling of hot pepper flakes. Decided to reduce the teriyaki sauce and sugar by two.

My dehydrator manual instructs "For food safety, to help insure any bacteria present is destroyed, post treatment of meat after dehydrating is required. Heat oven to 275 F. Line a large baking sheet with foil. Place jerky in a single layer, leaving a small space around each peace. Bake for 10 -12 minutes. Cool completely on wire rack. Pat jerky dry with paper towels to remove any surface fats before storing."

I have never followed the step before today, because I worried that it would over dry the meat. I decided to take the extra precaution because I am pregnant. The jerky was wonderful. I will alway use this extra step now, just to be extra safe.
I added a jar of Tabasco jelly to this recipe and added only 1/4 cup of brown sugar. Balanced out the sweet/spicy. My wife and I loved it!

I omit the liquid smoke. 
My kids (as well as the entire wrestling team) love this!!!

I loved this recipe. I used it on 4 pounds of venison and let it sit over the weekend before dehydrating it. I also added an eighth of a teaspoon of ghost pepper flakes and it gave it a subtle back of the throat burn that really gave it that extra oomph. I loved it and would recommend it to anyone looking for a good jerky recipe.

I was excited because of all the rave reviews. It was way too sweet for my tastes. And it needed more oomph.

Made again. 2T sugar and 1 - 2 T Franks. No teriyaki so doubled the soy.

This jerky recipe is AMAZING!!!! My husband had very good luck hunting this year and we had more than enough venison and I needed to think of new ways to prepare it. We used our little Ronco simple dehydrator and left it in for more like 8-10 hours (maybe we cut it too think). It was gone the first day! It has a very nice sweet taste at first and a little spicy kick at the end. We will be using this recipe A LOT!

it was great!



rachelle
This has become my "go to" jerky recipe everybody loves it.
Ive had a lot of jerky over the years an everyone an myself thought this was just AWESOME

This was my first time making deer jerky and I'm glad I picked this recipe. It taste exactly how it sounds. I did make a couple adjustments, I used Louisiana Hot Sauce for the hot pepper sauce, ran out of paprika so I used 1/2tsp of paprika and 1/2tsp chili powder, and didn't use the teriyaki sauce. I also added honey and Tony Chachere's. I used venison hamburger meat since it was my first time and did not want to waste my steak or backstrap and the only problem with that stuff is getting it to stick together while coming out of the jerky gun. I only marinated it for about 12 hours before putting it in the dehydrator. I couldn't tell but my girlfriend doesn't eat venison very much and said she could taste the "deer" so you might want to add some milk to it if you dont eat venison very much. Highly recommend this one.
This recipe is excellent! It pleases everyone in our family! Some of us love the taste of venison, some are a little picky how its fixed!!! Will definitely make again!!
I made three batches of this recipe, just as written. It is delicious. Better than any you can buy in town!
I made this with venison and it came out great!!
good one

We love this recipe, the first time we made it we didn't add the lemon juice and it was still good we're making it again tonight and tomorrow with the lemon juice added and we'll see how that turns out.
One of the best jerky recipe ever.

Excellent recipe!! Honestly the best jerky I have ever had. I did change one ingredient (due to not having it..). Instead of 1tsp of hot pepper sauce I used 2 tblsp's of Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce. I really liked the extra oriental flavor it gave. Overall this is a wonderful recipe. No more pre-made seasonings for this family!
DELICIOUS.... My son (15yrs old) made it with his first deer, and it was DELICIOUS!!!Very easy and simple recipe.

My husband hunts and I was looking for a way to prepare all the meat since I don't like venison AT ALL. I made this and it was gone in ten minutes! All my husband buddies from the hunt camp now give me their lean venison so I can make this jerky! You won't even know its venison! I added 1 tsp cayenne and it's perfect! I've also used moose and bison with this recipe,
This was a huge hit when I made this for my hubby and his brother. It has just the right blend of sweet and heat.
the best hands down
I made this Jerky today. Took it to a Football party. They couldn't get enough of them. Asked me to make more. They are Awesome! Debbie (Sarnia, Ontario)

SO yummy! I marinated it for two days and then hung it in the oven to dry out. I used sriracha hot sauce and they were a tiny bit too spicy and I'm a huge fan of spice so that's saying something. Already planning on making another batch this weekend!

This is just as the Title says, Sweet And Spicy. My first batch was too dry, being lazy and not getting out the Dehydrator & used the oven. This batch I used the Dehydrator and it is 100% better. A very good mix of Marinade that should carry a title Tangy Sweet & Spicy! Very Very Good! Two Thumbs Up for this one!
I loved it ! tho I did not put the hot pepper sauce it was still very yummy

This was one of the best jerky I have ever tasted. Hubby thought it was a little too sweet for him. He doesn't really care for sweet jerky much but I thought it was just amazing. I did use the same marinade which I put in the fridge a second time the following day to make more deer jerky and hubby really liked it. He said the flavors weren't as "intense". Thank you so much for this recipe.
this was very good, I used it for goose jerky. I left out the liquid smoke, and used the smoker. Racks were full 4 hrs at 160 degrees. I can't wait to try it on deer.

This was very good - I have to admit though, that I'm always looking to find ways to use less salt so I used granulated garlic and Bragg Soy substitute. I also used more hot pepper sauce (tabasco) as we like it spicy. It's also much easier to slice the roast if it's partially frozen making the slices more even. Thank you for sharing this recipe!

We made this recipes for our whole family EVERYONE loved it !!!! Even my kids :) It was spicy and sweet at the same time. My husband and I cooked it in the oven and it turned out wonderful. Thank You !!!!!
